name: Athey & Luca: Economists in Tech
description: JEP article 'Economists (and Economics) in Tech Companies' - foundational reading on why tech hires economists. Amazon employs 150+ PhD economists. Focuses on causal inference, market design, incentives. Full PDF: https://gsb-faculty.stanford.edu/susan-athey/files/2022/04/economists_in_tech.pdf

name: Amazon Science Blog
description: How Amazon's economics team works, research culture, and publications. Window into tech economist daily work.

name: Scarlet Chen: Econ PhD to Tech
description: Stanford PhD to Google/Shopify. Interview experiences at Google, Amazon, Facebook, Uber. 4-part comprehensive guide.

name: Ace the Data Science Interview
description: 201 real questions from FAANG, startups, Wall Street. Industry-standard prep resource covering role expectations.

name: Amazon Economist Careers
description: Dedicated Economist job family with RFCA (reduced-form), STRUC (structural), FMF (forecasting) tracks. Largest economist employer in tech.

name: Google Research Areas
description: Student Researcher positions.

name: Meta Core Data Science
description: Economics team within CDS focused on experimentation, causal inference, pricing, market design. Title: Research Scientist, Economics.

name: Should Your Tech Firm Have an Economist?
description: Framework for economist roles: advising strategy, building products, evaluating impact, thought leadership. Five comparative advantages over data scientists.

name: Wayfair Economics Group
description: ~15 PhD economists from MIT, Harvard, Northwestern. Explicit 'Economist' title and intern positions. Strong for applied micro.

name: LinkedIn Economic Graph
description: Studies labor market dynamics using LinkedIn data. Chief Economist Karin Kimbrough. Public research team with policy impact.

name: Stripe Economics of AI Fellowship
description: Chief Economist Ernie Tedeschi. $10K+ grants for academic economists. Partners with Stanford on research.

name: Salesforce AI Economist
description: Unique project combining AI and economics for economic policy optimization. Publications at NeurIPS, ICML.

name: Pharma HEOR Teams Overview
description: Biostatistics, VEO (Value Evidence Outcomes), RWE (Real-World Evidence) teams. 200+ statisticians at Lilly, Pfizer, Roche.

name: Rose Tan: Tech Jobs for Econ PhDs
description: LinkedIn guide on navigating tech's job market. Networking tips, role types, expectations. Key advice: don't be first economist.

name: Key Advice: Title vs Tasks
description: 'Data Scientist', 'Economist', 'Applied Scientist' can involve similar work. Title matters less than team and tasks.

name: NABE TEC Conference & Job Fair
description: Largest causal inference conference for tech economists (~800 participants). Free registration for job market PhDs. Amazon, Google, Netflix, Stripe recruit here. Resume deadline typically Sept-Oct. Essential networking event.

name: Economists in Tech LinkedIn Group
description: The only dedicated online community for economics PhDs in tech. Functions as informal job board where members share openings, provide referrals, and discuss interview processes. Free to join.

name: MIT CODE Conference
description: Premier academic conference for large-scale digital experimentation (Nov 14-15, Cambridge MA). Sponsored by Microsoft, Meta, Google with speakers from Netflix, Airbnb, Stripe, Lyft. Intimate size enables substantive networking.

name: ACM EC Conference
description: Economics and Computation conference at Stanford (July 2025). Focus on mechanism design, auctions, market design. Student registration just $5 through SIGecom membership.

name: Academic Economics Discord
description: Active community of 8,400+ members for peer support and ongoing discussion. Useful for job market questions, interview prep, and connecting with others making the academia-to-tech transition.

name: AEA JOE Listings
description: Tech companies post here: Amazon, Google, Microsoft, Uber, Airbnb, Wayfair, Stripe. Most DS roles on LinkedIn instead.

name: StatTrak Biostatistics Internships
description: ASA comprehensive list of pharma biostatistics internships with deadlines. Updated annually.

name: EuropeanHealthEconomics Jobs
description: HEOR job postings for pharma and consulting. European and global positions.

name: Amazon PhD Internship
description: Economics internship listings on Glassdoor.

name: Google PhD Programs
description: Research Intern PhD positions.

name: Meta Research Scientist
description: Research internship program portal.

name: Microsoft Research Careers
description: Microsoft Research internship portal.

name: Apple ML Research
description: ML Research Internships. No visible Economist team - requires pivot to ML/Data Science roles. Apple Scholars fellowship (invite-only).

name: Uber Applied Scientist
description: PhD Applied Scientist (Econ) Intern posting.

name: Lyft Economics Team
description: Lyft careers portal.

name: Wayfair Economist Intern
description: Explicit Economist Intern and Data Science Intern ($65/hour). ~15 PhD economists. Staff Economist $207-230K.

name: Airbnb Data Science
description: Data Science internship experience.

name: DoorDash Data Science
description: ML, Operations Research, and Data Science PhD internships (12 weeks, $2,200-2,600/week). Explicitly includes Economists.

name: Instacart ML PhD
description: ML PhD internships. Economists join as Data Scientists - pricing team has Econ PhDs.

name: eBay Data Science
description: Data Science internships available. Less emphasis on dedicated economist roles.

name: Etsy DSML Research
description: Data Science Intern ($70-75/hr), Research PhD Intern. Marketplace Economics projects. DSML team.

name: LinkedIn Applied Research
description: Applied Research Internship 12 weeks. Economic Graph Research Program studies labor markets.

name: Spotify Research Scientist
description: Research Scientist PhD Internship 10-12 weeks (NYC or London). Explicitly welcomes Economics PhDs. Check for annual deadline (typically early February).

name: Netflix Careers
description: ML/AI Scientist Intern PhD track. Prefers candidates with industry experience (unlike most companies). Public Policy Economists (SEAL team) is a separate track. Internships crucial - 'not possible to do too many.'

name: Pinterest Labs
description: PhD ML and PhD Data Science internships ($12,100/month). Economics PhD accepted.

name: Discord Data Science
description: Data Science Intern - ML, Causal Inference ($78-90/hour for PhD). Seasonal postings, no formal PhD program.

name: Snap Research
description: Snap Research Internship 16-24 weeks. Less economics focus, more CV/ML.

name: Stripe PhD Internship
description: Stripe research positions.

name: PayPal PhD Intern
description: Data Scientist PhD Intern, ML Scientist PhD Intern ($41-61/hour). Global Analytics & Data Science (GADS). Risk focus.

name: Robinhood Data Scientist
description: Data Scientist Intern (Master's or PhD). 48-hour take-home challenge. A/B testing and experimentation emphasis.

name: Affirm Careers
description: Strong credit risk and quantitative markets roles. SWE internship exists but no formal PhD pipeline.

name: Block (Square) Careers
description: Focus on software engineering. No visible economist roles or research team.

name: Adobe Research Internship
description: Hundreds of PhD interns annually. 12 research areas. Strong mentorship. Apply: research-internship-phd@adobe.com

name: Salesforce AI Research
description: AI Research Intern minimum 12 weeks. AI Economist project. Publications at NeurIPS, ICML, ACL.

name: Databricks Research
description: PhD GenAI Research Scientist Intern, Data Science Intern. Explicitly accepts Economics PhDs. Causal inference focus.

name: Intuit AI Research
description: AI Research Intern, AI Science Intern. Fintech AI applications. Contact: ai-research@intuit.com

name: Eli Lilly Statistics
description: 12-week Statistics Internship. Global Statistical Sciences (200+ statisticians). Applications typically due early January.

name: Pfizer Biostatistics
description: 12-week program, 15+ positions. Biostatistics (200+ statisticians), HV&E (HEOR). Applications typically due late January.

name: J&J Statistics
description: Statistics & Decision Sciences Intern (8-10 positions, Spring House PA, Titusville NJ). Applications typically due mid-February.

name: Moderna Biostatistics
description: Biostatistics Intern 10-12 weeks, Cambridge MA. mRNA clinical development focus.

name: Roche Global Biostatistics
description: Biostatistics PhD Summer Internship (UK: 10 weeks). 600+ statisticians globally. HEOR team.

name: Genentech E4A/HEOR
description: 10-12 week summer internships. Posting window November-March. Biostatistics, Evidence for Access (E4A), Translational AI Lab.

name: Optum HEOR
description: Optum AI PhD Intern (remote available). HEOR team for life sciences data analytics.

name: Roblox Virtual Economy
description: Data Scientist - PhD Intern, Applied Scientist - PhD Intern (12-16 weeks, $60-64/hour). Explicitly hires Economics PhDs for virtual economy.

name: OpenAI Residency
description: OpenAI careers portal.

name: Anthropic Careers
description: Explicitly states 'We do not offer internships'. Full-time only as Member of Technical Staff. ~50% have PhDs. Networking very essential.

name: Notion Careers
description: No formal PhD program. General internships accept PhD students. 12-week project-focused.

name: Takeda-UIC HEOR Fellowship
description: 2-year Health Economics and Outcomes Research fellowship program. Strong for pharma career path.

name: DeepMind Student Researcher
description: Student Researcher Program for PhD students. Research collaborations with academic mentors.

name: DataLemur SQL
description: Free SQL practice with FAANG questions. Created by ex-Facebook authors of Ace the Data Science Interview.

name: StrataScratch
description: Company-specific SQL filtering for Airbnb, Uber, Netflix. Real interview questions with solutions.

name: Window Functions Practice
description: Interactive quizzes on ROW_NUMBER, RANK, LAG/LEAD. Consistently tested in interviews.

name: Interview Query
description: Data science interview platform with SQL, Python, and ML questions. Take-home challenges included.

name: Nick Singh's 40 Stats Questions
description: Probability and statistics questions from FAANG and Wall Street. Bayesian puzzles and distributions.

name: StatQuest with Josh Starmer
description: Best resource for econ PhDs learning ML. Bias-variance, regularization, ensemble methods explained accessibly.

name: Trustworthy Online Controlled Experiments (Kohavi)
description: The industry bible by Kohavi, Tang, Xu (Microsoft/LinkedIn/Google). Design, analysis, pitfalls of A/B testing at scale. Only 1/3 of well-designed experiments improve metrics. Free site: experimentguide.com

name: Understanding CUPED
description: Bridges CUPED to DiD and regression. Essential for industry A/B testing interviews.

name: Netflix: Quasi Experimentation
description: When A/B tests aren't feasible and how Netflix handles SUTVA violations.

name: Emma Ding: Product Sense Guide
description: Ultimate guide to business case interviews. AARRR framework, metrics, diagnostic approaches.

name: Amplitude: North Star Metrics
description: Three games framework: Attention, Transaction, Productivity. Real examples from Facebook, Airbnb, Spotify.

name: DataLemur Meta DS Guide
description: 31 leaked Meta interview questions. Product sense and SQL focus.

name: Scarlet Ink: Amazon LP Guide
description: Written by ex-Amazon Bar Raiser. Sent by recruiters to candidates. 100+ candidates credit it for getting hired.

name: Amazon Leadership Principles
description: Official 16 principles with explanations. Customer Obsession, Ownership, Invent and Simplify, etc.

name: Interviewing.io Amazon Guide
description: Insights from 500+ mock Amazon behavioral interviews. STARI method with Action at 50-60%.

name: IGotAnOffer: Google Behavioral
description: Googleyness traits: comfort with ambiguity, bias for action, intellectual humility.

name: Designing Machine Learning Systems
description: Essential ML system design book by Chip Huyen. Based on Stanford CS 329S.

name: ML System Design Interview (Alex Xu)
description: 7-step framework with 10 detailed solutions: visual search, video recommendation, ad prediction.

name: ML Interviews GitHub
description: 7.2k stars. Created by someone with offers from Meta, Google, Amazon, Apple for Applied Scientist.

name: Chip Huyen ML Interviews Book
description: 200+ knowledge questions organized by difficulty for ML fundamentals.

name: Interview Query Take-Homes
description: 23 real take-home challenges from Airbnb, Stripe, Uber, DoorDash, Amazon with solutions.

name: Candor Salary Negotiation Guide
description: Complete framework for total compensation negotiation: base, equity valuation (public vs startup), signing bonuses, level negotiation. Harvard Career Services recommended. Helped one executive secure $5.4M more.

name: Haseeb Qureshi: Ten Rules for Negotiating
description: Gold standard negotiation guide from ex-poker player who negotiated $250K at Airbnb for first tech job. Game-theory approach: information control, BATNA development, handling exploding offers.

name: Levels.fyi Negotiation Guide
description: From platform that helped negotiate $31M+ in raises. Covers total comp breakdown, equity at public vs private companies, leveling systems, location impact. Companion database has 75K+ verified data points.

name: Interviewing.io Negotiation Series
description: Word-for-word scripts from platform with 94% success rate and $50K average gain. Exposes recruiter psychology and information-extraction tactics. Includes Meta-specific playbook.

name: Team Rora: Applied Scientist Negotiation
description: Only guide specifically for Applied Scientist roles. 400+ FAANG negotiations. Includes exact salary bands (Amazon L5: $170-220K base, $351-588K equity). Sign-ons can reach $100K+ with proper leverage.

name: HBR: Why Tech Hires Economists
description: 5 key areas: ads design, ROI estimation, marketplace incentives, causal inference, equilibrium effects.

name: Evan's Industry Job Finding Advice
description: Econ PhD who conducted 250+ interviews at Amazon shares job search strategy. Failed 2014 search (30 apps, 0 offers) → successful 2015 (100 apps, 35 interviews, Amazon offer). Covers networking, resume, behavioral interviews, technical prep.

name: Jed Kolko: Should Your Firm Have an Economist?
description: Economists as public spokespeople and internal analysts at Indeed, Glassdoor, Zillow.

name: Eugene Yan: DS vs Applied vs Research vs MLE
description: Clearest breakdown: DS→documents, Applied Scientist→ML systems, Research Scientist→papers, MLE→infrastructure.

name: TDS: Applied vs Research Scientist
description: Applied Scientists are 'same caliber as research scientists, but experts in implementing at scale.'

name: Neptune.ai: MLE vs Data Scientist
description: MLEs take models to production: optimization, MLOps, A/B testing, containerization, deployment.

name: 365 Data Science: DS vs MLE Skills
description: ML requirements: 69.3% for DS vs 88.3% for MLE. AI: 21.2% for DS vs 60.4% for MLE.

name: Daliana Liu: Product DS vs Analyst
description: Product DS does predictive/prescriptive analysis with experiments; Analyst does descriptive dashboards.

name: TDS: Product Analytics Explained
description: Product analysts provide timely insights; DS works on longer, in-depth projects.

name: Greg Rafferty: Hidden Career Ladder
description: L3→L4 reliable, L4→L5 strategic (defining vs solving problems), L5→L6 multiplier (scaling through others).

name: Data Science Leadership: Career Ladder
description: Tasks (Junior) → Projects (Mid) → Products (Senior/Principal). Mental model progression.

name: Design Gurus: FAANG Levels Comparison
description: Meta E3-E10, Google L3-L10, Amazon SDE I-III. Senior (L5) is 'terminal level' where many plateau.

name: What is Data Science at Lyft?
description: Maps the entire marketplace DS landscape: Marketplace team designs dispatch/pricing, Fleet team builds optimal pricing models. Shows how pricing pairs economics literature with econometrics.

name: Uber: Surge Pricing Moves Drivers
description: DiD analysis shows surge heatmap visibility explains 10-60% of driver self-positioning decisions.

name: Airbnb: Learning Market Dynamics for Pricing
description: ML + structural modeling for booking arrival processes and dynamic pricing policies.

name: Amazon: Science of Price Experiments
description: Crossover experiments, random-days, causal forests for non-discriminatory pricing. Can't show different prices.

name: Lyft: Causal Forecasting
description: DS builds causal models that are both predictive AND causally valid using experiments.

name: DataRoot Labs: Surge Pricing Algorithms
description: Uber uses LSTM networks; Lyft implements Prime Time (200% increase) and Happy Hour (50% discount).

name: Beyond Winning: Spotify's Experiments with Learning Framework
description: Learning rate (64%) exceeds win rate (12%) at mature products. Platform serves ~300 teams. Shows how experimentation platforms measure their own ROI.

name: Uber: XP Experimentation Platform
description: 1,000+ experiments at any time. Supports A/B/N tests, causal inference, multi-armed bandits.

name: Booking.com: Moving Fast with Experiments
description: Automated 'circuit breaker' monitors for errors and aborts releases within seconds.

name: Airbnb: Interleaving Experiments
description: 50x sensitivity improvement in search ranking by blending control/treatment for direct comparison.

name: Microsoft: Deep Dive Into Variance Reduction
description: CUPED introduced 2013; effectively multiplies observed traffic for faster experiments.

name: Nubank: CUPED Implementation
description: 40% of metric comparisons had variance reduced by 20%+ after implementing CUPED.

name: Matteo Courthoud: CUPED Technical Guide
description: CUPED used at Netflix, Booking, Meta, Uber, Airbnb, LinkedIn, DoorDash, Faire.

name: DoorDash: Switchback Experiment Analysis
description: Three-sided marketplace needs region-time randomization. Achieved 30% faster experimentation.

name: LinkedIn: Detecting Interference in A/B Tests
description: A/B test of A/B tests comparing individual-level vs cluster-based randomization.

name: Lyft: Marketplace Experimentation
description: Interference-free treatment effect estimators for ridesharing marketplace.

name: Meta: Cluster Experimentation
description: Even 1% cluster purity provides 3x improvement in reducing test interactions.

name: Uber CausalML Package
description: Open-source uplift modeling and CATE estimation with meta-learners (S, T, X-learner).

name: Tinuiti: Ghost Ads Explained
description: Google/Amazon 2017: log when ad would show but doesn't, creating cost-free control groups.

name: Machine Learning for Snapchat Ad Ranking
description: End-to-end tour of ad systems: eligibility filtering, candidate generation, ML models, auction, feedback loop. Explains budget-split A/B testing for two-sided marketplaces.

name: Remerge: Incrementality Tests 101
description: Intent-to-treat vs PSA vs ghost ads vs ghost bids comparison for ad measurement.

name: Meaningful Metrics: How Data Sharpened the Focus of Product Teams
description: Markov model segments users into activity states, monitors transition probabilities. CURR identified as highest-leverage metric—drove 4x DAU growth over 3 years.

name: CXL: Growth Experimentation Culture
description: Spotify: 75-80% of teams perform experimentation. Discover Weekly validated through experiments.

name: Scaling Safety and Civility on Roblox
description: Moderates content for 71M daily users. 10% of FTEs + $100M+/year on safety. 53% reduction in abuse reports after real-time voice safety.

name: Stripe: Similarity Clustering for Fraud
description: Gradient-boosted trees predict account similarity, catching hundreds of fraudulent accounts weekly.

name: Stripe: ML for Fraud Primer
description: 90% of cards have been seen before, providing rich behavioral data for fraud detection.

name: Lyft: Fleet Team DS
description: Setting rental rates, understanding price-demand relationships, fleet allocation through time series.

name: Instacart Anytime: A Data Science Paradigm
description: Maps Shopper Staffing across Marketplace Forecasting, Supply Planning, Real-time Capacity. Shows how forecasts feed downstream decision systems.

name: Uber Orbit: Bayesian Time Series
description: Open-source tool for KPI decomposition into trend, seasonality, and marketing effects.

name: Uber: LSTM for Extreme Events
description: Neural networks handle NYE, concerts, and weather across 600+ cities.

name: Uber Omphalos: Backtesting Infrastructure
description: Infrastructure for comparing forecasting models across millions of time series.

name: Meta: How DS Lead and Drive Impact
description: Fully embedded model: DS 1-to-1 with PMs, accountable for product outcomes.

name: Candor: Meta DS Roles Guide
description: Core Data Science is distinct R&D team developing novel methods, separate from embedded analytics.

name: Microsoft: Designing DS Organization
description: Centralized DS for career paths with peers, scaled processes, end-to-end perspective.

name: Shanif Dhanani: Embedded vs Centralized
description: Hybrid recommended: centralized management with embedded deployment.

name: dbt Labs: Centralized vs Decentralized
description: Most companies evolve through multiple organizational models as they scale.

name: Stitch Fix Algorithms Tour
description: Interactive visual tour of 10 algorithmic applications. Covers exploration vs exploitation, cold-start problems, human-in-the-loop stylist collaboration.

name: Netflix: Recommendations Research
description: 80%+ of content discovered through recommendations, 20 years of refinement by hundreds of engineers.

name: Athey & Imbens: ML Methods for Economists
description: ML optimizes prediction; economics focuses on causal inference. Bridging both fields.

name: Susan Athey: ML Short Course
description: Free Stanford materials bridging ML and economics methods.

name: Matt Sosna: Academia to Data Science
description: Key gaps: implementing analysis results (not just generating), SWE for production, team vs personal output.

name: Microsoft Experimentation Platform
description: Technical and cultural challenges of A/B testing at scale. Companies run 20,000+ experiments/year.

name: Doing Data Science at Uber
description: Profile of hybrid DS/SWE role at Uber. Describes the expectations and work.

name: Building Uber's DS Platforms
description: Director-level perspective on democratizing data science at scale.

name: Uber Data Science Workbench
description: Platform used for pricing, safety, fraud detection. End-to-end DS workflow.

name: Netflix DS and Engineering Team
description: Team overview: data science at the center of Netflix's product decisions.

name: Netflix: Experimentation Focus
description: Experimentation is a major focus of data science across Netflix.

name: Netflix ML Systems (Metaflow)
description: Supporting diverse ML systems with the Metaflow ecosystem.

name: Airbnb Data University
description: Internal training program with 30+ classes democratizing data science.

name: Meta: Building DS Teams at Scale
description: Organizational structure for data science teams with impact at scale.

name: Google Research Careers
description: Research environment with focus on product impact at Google.

name: Eppo Documentation
description: CUPED++ with post-stratification, Bayesian/frequentist approaches, sequential testing, clustered experiments, switchback experiments. Written by ex-Airbnb data scientists. Replaces Kohavi's A/B testing book.

name: Statsig Docs + Blog
description: CUPED with math derivations, sequential testing (mSPRT), Bayesian experiments, winsorization, power analysis. Facebook-level statistical rigor. Free sample size calculators.

name: Netflix Tech Blog: Experimentation
description: Platform architecture, organizational culture, causal inference, contextual bandits. Real case studies from thousands of annual experiments. Covers cultural aspects missing from technical resources.

name: khangich/machine-learning-interview
description: 100+ curated questions: bias-variance, regularization, neural networks, backprop, CNNs, RNNs. 11.6k GitHub stars. Includes ML system design cases: YouTube recs, LinkedIn feed, ad CTR. Author received NVIDIA, Microsoft, Amazon offers.

name: alirezadir/Machine-Learning-Interviews
description: 6 structured chapters: algorithms, ML coding, fundamentals, system design, behavioral. Updated 2025 with Agentic AI chapter. Author received offers from Meta, Google, Amazon, Apple. MIT licensed.

name: Chip Huyen's ML Interviews (Free!)
description: 200+ questions across math, CS, ML workflows, algorithms. Difficulty tagged. 30 systems design questions. Companion answers at github.com/zafstojano/ml-interview-questions-and-answers. The book is FREE online.

name: Made With ML
description: 47 free lessons covering complete ML lifecycle: product design, data prep, feature engineering, training, serving, monitoring, CI/CD, testing. 30k GitHub stars. Includes working code from laptop to distributed cluster.

name: Eugene Yan's Blog + Applied ML
description: Amazon Principal Applied Scientist. Deep articles on feature stores, real-time retrieval, ML testing. His applied-ml repo has 600+ curated papers from Netflix, Spotify, Pinterest. Co-authored 'A Year of Building with LLMs' (O'Reilly).

name: Stanford CS 329S Materials
description: Same author as Chip Huyen's book, same content. Free lecture notes: ML production, training data, feature engineering, deployment, monitoring. Guest tutorials from Made With ML, Stitch Fix. 24 final project demos on YouTube.

name: Hello Interview: ML System Design
description: 6-step framework with timing recommendations. Free worked examples: Video Recommendations, Harmful Content Detection, Bot Detection. Written by former Meta and Amazon hiring managers.

name: khangich: ML System Design Cases
description: 6 complete ML system design cases: YouTube recommendations, LinkedIn feed ranking, ad click prediction, delivery time estimation, Airbnb search ranking. Links to source company engineering blogs.

name: alirezadir: 9-Step ML Design Formula
description: Structured 9-step formula: problem clarification, data requirements, ML objective, offline/online metrics, feature engineering, candidate generation → ranking → filters, training data, architecture, serving/deployment.

name: DataLemur (Same Author as Book!)
description: 100+ free practice questions: SQL, Python, statistics, ML, probability. Same author as 'Ace the Data Science Interview'. 60+ SQL from FAANG with solutions. Interactive PostgreSQL environment. Free 9-day crash course.

name: rbhatia46/Data-Science-Interview-Resources
description: 200+ curated links: probability/stats (40+ questions), SQL, ML algorithms, real case studies, FAANG-specific prep, deep learning (40+ questions), NLP (30+ questions), Spark (55+ questions), GenAI topics.

name: khanhnamle1994/cracking-the-data-science-interview
description: Downloadable cheatsheets (SQL, stats, ML/DL), question bank with '150 Essential DS Questions' PDF, case studies, portfolio examples. Closest structural equivalent to the book. 4.4k GitHub stars.
